definition: love at first sight
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: People fall in love with the circled golden woollen carpet AT first sight because of its unique design.
sentences.chinese: 盤金羊毛地毯以其獨特的設計讓人一見傾心。

sentences.english: Henry and Jeanne take a shine to each other.
sentences.chinese: 亨利和珍妮彼此一見傾心。

sentences.english: Don't underestimate love at first sight.
I was already developing a crush on her.
Without being an exception, Shen was also totally attracted by her beauty.
sentences.chinese: 毫無例外地，她的美麗，也讓沈從文一見傾心。

sentences.english: It was at first sight, as the novels say.
sentences.chinese: 正如小說中所說的，那是一見傾心。

sentences.english: Julius Caesar was ravished by Cleopatra's beauty.
sentences.chinese: 克婁巴特拉的美貌使愷撒一見傾心。

sentences.english: Hennry and Jenny took a shine to each other .
sentences.chinese: 亨利和珍妮彼此一見傾心。

sentences.english: Maggie: You mean love at first sight?
sentences.chinese: 你信任一見傾心的愛情嗎？

sentences.english: After east wind of week of elegant come across of female actor article, also see admire, pursuit of do all one can.
sentences.chinese: 女藝人文雅偶遇周東風后，也一見傾心，奮力追求。

sentences.english: Love it at sight, never tireless, deserve to own.
sentences.chinese: 一見傾心，百看不厭，值得擁有。

sentences.english: Helly and Jenny they take a shine to each other.
sentences.chinese: 亨利和珍妮彼此一見傾心。

sentences.english: To the word love at first sight.

definition: magnificent style unmatched in his generation (idiom); peerless talent
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to be determined to win (idiom)
loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
(in former times) to bind one's hair on coming of age
numerous and confused/in a mess
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
lit. to lift the tray to eyebrow level (idiom); mutual respect in a marriage
to tease/to poke fun at
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to envy/to admire
to regret not having met earlier (idiom); It is nice to meet you finally./It feels like we have known each other all along.
(literary) to smile
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
dazzling/brilliant
cheering excitedly (idiom)/jubilant
